TextView.android:text: 1 Alphabet Review You have already studied 17 strokes in the Gregg Shorthand alphabet. How fast can you read them?
2 OO The shorthand stroke for the sound of oo, as in to, is a tiny upward hook.

â€¢ Observe that the oo is placed on its side when it follows n ar m, as in new, noon, move. By placing the hook on its side in these combinations rather than writing it upright, we obtain smooth joinings.
3 W, Sw At the beginning of words w, as in we, is represented by the oo hook; sw, as in sweet, by s-oo.
4 Wh Wh, as in why and while, is also represented by the oo hook.
5 Useful Phrases Here are a number of useful phrases that use the oo hook..
6 K, G The shorthand stroke for k is a short forward curve.
The shorthand stroke for the hard sound of g, as in game, is a much longer forward curve. It is called gay.
